title: Father pranks his daughter with a 'broken phone' app he made himself - but it backfires badly
text:

A father who tried to prank his daughter with a 'broken phone' app he had created himself was left with egg on his face when it backfired badly. 
Gary Simon had created a piece of software that made his daughter's favourite game appear as though it had been corrupted by 'evil forces'. 
He explained that he and his daughters continually played jokes on each other, and it was his turn to get one of them back. 
As well as changing the cute dog character into a demon, the app also emitted a loud beeping noise after being opened up and made the front screen look as though it had been cracked. Gary makes his phone screen appear as though it has cracked (Photo: Gary Simon) 
Pleased with his idea, Gary then handed his phone over to his daughter so she could play her game. 
But moments later, it all started to go very wrong. 
As the phone was 'corrupted', the frightened girl immediately handed back to her father and ran away, yelling: "I'm scared." Read More 
Unable to hold back laughter, Gary then told his daughter she'd been 'trolled', prompting her to immediately burst into tears and call for her mum. 
Hilariously, the footage then cuts Gary and his little girl heading into a toy store. 
With a huge smile on her face, the little girl starts picking out her latest toy. The plan backfired when his daughter burst into tears (Photo: Gary Simon) Read More Fed-up girlfriend soaks toilet roll in pepper spray to get revenge 
Her father asks: "You going to hate me still?", to which she happily replies: "No." 
Afterwards, Gary posted the method for his 'evil' app online, writing: "It may seem a bit cruel, especially based on her reaction in the above video (yikes, I was not expecting that). But I decided to bribe back her affection with a trip to Toys 'R' Us." 
You can check out Gary's app in further detail on his website Coursetro.com . Like us on Facebook
